messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=c793965b31d8 ***

math: remove repeated comment.

R=golang-dev, nigeltao
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046

Committer: Nigel Tao <nigeltao@golang.org>

https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go
File src/pkg/math/sqrt.go (left):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go#oldcode7
src/pkg/math/sqrt.go:7: // Sqrt returns the square root of x.
perhaps not a big deal, but i think we'd better remove the latter
copy of the document and keep func Sqrt at the top of the file
so that people won't need to bother with the long comment.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go
File src/pkg/math/sqrt.go (left):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go#oldcode7
src/pkg/math/sqrt.go:7: // Sqrt returns the square root of x.
On 2013/03/22 19:40:32, minux wrote:
> perhaps not a big deal, but i think we'd better remove the latter
> copy of the document and keep func Sqrt at the top of the file
> so that people won't need to bother with the long comment.

For better or worse, other .go files in pkg/math are like this, such as erf.go, jn.go, tan.go...

On 2013/03/22 22:35:06, nigeltao wrote:
> https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go
> File src/pkg/math/sqrt.go (left):
> 
> https://codereview.appspot.com/7835046/diff/5001/src/pkg/math/sqrt.go#oldcode7
> src/pkg/math/sqrt.go:7: // Sqrt returns the square root of x.
> On 2013/03/22 19:40:32, minux wrote:
> > perhaps not a big deal, but i think we'd better remove the latter
> > copy of the document and keep func Sqrt at the top of the file
> > so that people won't need to bother with the long comment.
> 
> For better or worse, other .go files in pkg/math are like this, such as erf.go,
> jn.go, tan.go...

I think some people are more interested in the Methods rather than the implementations. And logically the methods precede implementations.
Some functions do not need the "dummy declarations" (e.g. Asinh), 
so I prefer to maintain the status quo.

subject: code review 7835046: math: remove repeated comment.
